content: You have entered a circular map. In the following questions, I will tell you what items are on the map, as well as your position and movements. You need to tell me the item you find after your movements. Please provide only the name of the item. Note that your answer should include only the name of the item and no other words.(Notice that for the same ring map, if the second path moves one step clockwise and one step counterclockwise from the first path, the endpoints reached in both cases should be the same.)

You have been given a circular path consisting of 5 connected dots. At the start, you are positioned on the dot that is located at the top of the path, where you find a Welsh Springer Spaniel. Moving in a clockwise direction from the Welsh Springer Spaniel, the elements on the path are a tiger, a velvet, a switch, and a stopwatch. Starting from the Welsh Springer Spaniel, you move around the ring by 2 steps in a counter-clockwise direction, and you move around the ring by 5 steps in a clockwise direction. What will you find?
I find a switch on the next item on the path after moving counter-clockwise for 2 steps and a stopwatch on the next item on the path after moving clockwise for 5 steps.

You have been given a circular path consisting of 5 connected dots. At the start, you are positioned on the dot that is located at the top of the path, where you find a Welsh Springer Spaniel. Moving in a clockwise direction from the Welsh Springer Spaniel, the elements on the path are a tiger, a velvet, a switch, and a stopwatch. Starting from the Welsh Springer Spaniel, you move around the ring by 1 step in a clockwise direction, and you move around the ring by 1 step in a counter-clockwise direction, and you move around the ring by 2 steps in a counter-clockwise direction, and you move around the ring by 5 steps in a clockwise direction. What will you find?

I find a switch after moving clockwise by 1 step, a velvet after moving counter-clockwise by 1 step, a stopwatch after moving counter-clockwise by 2 steps, and a tiger after moving clockwise by 5 steps.
